title: G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) - Bio Science Stream
description: A strong pass in the G.C.E. A/L Bio Science stream is the fundamental requirement for a university degree in this field. A passion for nature and physical fitness are also essential.

title: Bachelor's Degree in a Relevant Field
description: Complete a BSc degree in Forestry and Environmental Science, or Zoology and Environmental Management. These programs provide the scientific knowledge base required for the profession.
institutes: University of Sri Jayewardenepura (Faculty of Applied Sciences)

title: Join a Government Department via Competitive Exam
description: To become a government officer, you must pass the competitive examination for recruitment into the Department of Wildlife Conservation (as a Wildlife Ranger/Officer) or the Forest Department (as a Forester/Range Forest Officer).
qualifications: Pass in the relevant government competitive exam

title: Field Officer (Wildlife Ranger / Forest Officer)
description: Work in a national park, forest reserve, or a regional office. Your duties will include patrolling to prevent poaching and illegal logging, conducting wildlife surveys, managing human-wildlife conflict, and community outreach.

title: Senior Officer / Park Warden / Researcher
description: With experience and promotions, you can advance to manage a section of a park, or become the Warden in charge of an entire national park. With higher education (MSc/PhD), you can also transition into the research divisions of these departments or work for conservation NGOs.
qualifications: MSc/PhD in Conservation Biology or related field
